1108378590419316739.text: We keep talking about suicides rising ... the best way to stop the suicides in the long run is to stop the unnecessary wars that continue causing trauma and stress to our military families. I’ve spent years in and out of therapy because of the stress I endured while I served.

1108378594739449857.text: To our Congressional leaders — if you’re serious about stopping the suicides, you have to address the source of the trauma... the wars. 1108367344508624896.text: The intelligence we had was faulty, as usual. This man and his family weren’t involved in the insurgency. Nevertheless, my squad destroyed this poor man’s home. When questioning leaders why? They often said “should have let us in” despite the language barrier.

1108367342801575936.text: When the confused man failed to give the respond, my squad leader had me kick in the door and clear the building. Inside were terrified women and children, wailing in fear.

1108367338598891521.text: This ain’t a story I am proud to tell, it still lives in my nightmares. In 2007, my squad entered and cleared a large compound. Inside the compound walls, my squad leader screamed in English for the owner to open all the doors or we’d kick them in.

1108353700379197440.text:

1108353699712253952.text: On the day of the funeral, everyone in my friend’s hometown came out to show support. They even closed school so kids could stand along the street and wave flags at our cars. I was a civilian, but my old unit was there in uniform. Many of them were getting ready to deploy to Iraq

1108353698667868162.text: When I got back to my apartment after visiting the boots exhibit, there was a message waiting for me. A friend I served with had died in Iraq that day. His convoy had been traveling past a small village on the Euphrates when they hit an IED, killing him and two others.

1108353697090887682.text: The previous year I’d come home from Afghanistan, where I served as a medic with the 82nd Airborne. My unit saw the worst consequences of war, but we all made it back. While not a scientific poll, these results are an indication of the views of thousands of the most politically active progressive veterans around the country.

@commondefense plans to continue to consult our members as the primary unfolds. Sign up now:https://commondefense.us/

1084849277485105153.text: The results above are not a scientific poll, they are the results of a survey emailed to 150,000 members of @commondefense, which was then sorted by self-reported veteran status, and results rounded to the nearest 0.5%.

1084848780938264576.text:
Among only veterans who voted for @HillaryClinton in 2016, the top four preferences for 2020 are:

1. @JoeBiden 29.5%
2. @BetoORourke 16.5%
3. @ewarren 10%
4. @KamalaHarris 9%

1084848437915512839.text:
Among only veterans who voted for @BernieSanders in 2016, the top four preferences for 2020 are:

1. @BernieSanders 42%

3. @BetoORourke 10%
4. @JoeBiden 8%
